definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

sentences.english: Determination of rare earth elements Cerium, Europium, Yttrium with DBC-chlorophosphonazo by solid phase spectrophotometry;
sentences.chinese: 偶氮氯膦固相光度法測定稀土元素鈰，銪，釔。

sentences.english: Europium and terbium rare earth complexes with tetracarboxylic acid were successfully prepared in aqueous solution.
sentences.chinese: 在水溶液中合成了銪和試的四元羧酸稀土配合物。

sentences.english: It was europium from Mountain Pass, for instance, that made colour television possible.
sentences.chinese: 例如，帕斯山生產的銪，使彩色電視機產生成爲可能。

sentences.english: After the impurities were extracted from raffinate, some products of fluorescent grade europia were produced.
sentences.chinese: 萃餘液經萃取除雜後，獲一定量的熒光級氧化銪產品。

sentences.english: The chondrite-normalized REE patterns exhibit a gently right-dipping V-type curve with a severe depletion in Eu.
sentences.chinese: 稀土元素模式曲線具緩右傾“V”字形，銪虧損強烈。

definition: to confer/to bestow on an inferior/to reward
a long narrow vessel with two masts
